summary:
As all-round technology enthusiast, I have a lot of fun supporting and improving mission-critical and high-availability infrastructure in high-stakes environments.

Since the only limit to the value of technology (whether for business, the customers or the world) is the team that delivers it, I enjoy implementing modern concepts like DevOps, continuous integration and autonomous teams into practice.

Specialties: Cloud computing & high-availability infrastructure, integration middleware and team development.

profile_positions.description:
Helping companies become real-time responsive with Axual's Enterprise Streaming Platform based on Apache Kafka.

From financials to retail, from telecom to energy. Axual puts your company in pole position on the data-driven highway.
profile_positions.title: Product Owner Cloud / Customer Success Engineer

profile_positions.description:
Helping companies become real-time responsive with Axual's Enterprise Streaming Platform based on Apache Kafka.

From financials to retail, from telecom to energy. Axual puts your company in pole position on the data-driven highway.
profile_positions.title: Enterprise Streaming Platform Engineer / Customer Success Engineer

profile_positions.description:
Supporting the InfoPlus Team of the Conclusion Mission Critical company with their application messaging infrastructure, based on RabbitMQ.

This job requires balancing the operational requirements of providing 24/7 public transport information with the company desire to transform monolithic backends into loosely coupled microservices that communicate through RabbitMQ.
profile_positions.title: Consulting Messaging Specialist / Mission Critical Engineer

profile_positions.description:
Helping a small team of dedicated and skilled technical professionals develop as a kickass Ops Team that supports and improves best-in-class Integration Middleware and other Managed Services.

One JIRA ticket at a time if we have to, leaps and bounds if we can.

Inevitably, I facilitate my team by being the resident wifi-whisperer, whiteboard info-sec technician and percussive maintenance wizard. My main responsibiliteis however are offering focus and guidance to my team members in all operational matters and supplying management with progress and tactical reports, with a good side of honest technical contribution to the team.
profile_positions.title: Teamlead Managed Services

profile_positions.description:
The Payments division of the Rabobank enables the daily smooth processing of millions of payments in- and outside of the Netherlands.

As Operations Engineer I worked on and supported the systems that are critical to making sure that payments are done fast, securely and precisely. Not only was my focus on making continuous improvements to ongoing SEPA operations, but also on helping implement future systems that speed up payments and radically alter the way we pay.
profile_positions.title: Operations Engineer Payments

profile_positions.description:
Modern banking is highly dependent on timely exchange of information and data. As part of the Cloud Provisioning division of the Infrastructure Services department, the Connections group provides messages and file transfer services that are highly available, secure and preserve data integrity, even when transferring between platforms and partners.

Within the Connections group I was a lead specialist in Websphere MQ and Connect:Direct as technologies, able to support them across multiple platforms (z/OS, AIX, Linux, Windows, HP NonStop). My affinity and responsibilities included both daily operations as well as change implementation and delivery. Within the team I grew into a senior engineer role, helping junior coworkers develop their skills and grow in their own roles. All of this is only more challenging and fun in an environment that's transforming from a traditional 'monolithic' IT organization, to one that is shifting to short, responsive, delivery cycles and tighter "DevOps" integration.

Within Rabobank I became deeply involved with (and pretty passionate about) the requirements of the Payments group, facilitating and improving the daily operations of primarily the SEPA and SWIFT payment systems teams, enabling the smooth operation of millions of payments transactions daily.
profile_positions.title: Middleware Infrastructure Specialist

profile_positions.description:
The mission of DB Able is to analyse and optimise Business and IT processes. As senior employee I was positioned in multiple roles.

One role was to have direct contact with clients to make an analysis of their current business processes and identify area's in need of improvement using BPM notation flows.

In the other, using System Center Orchestrator 2012 as primary tool, I developed automated workflows that enabled enterprises to both make their processes more effective and efficient while also increasing their control and ensuring compliance.

As DB Able is a very small company, I also took responsibility for basic office IT, such as setting up the LAN, server administration and maintaining the corporate blog.
profile_positions.title: Process Analyst / Orchestration Engineer

profile_positions.description:
Jitscale is a company that positions itself as a provider of 24x7, high available, quickly scaling, cloud solutions. Customers include financial services, e-commerce and media companies.

My role within the company was an all-round Linux Professional. I performed systems administration, application management, network administration, hardware maintenance & technical support for hosted (preferably open source-based) internet commerce platforms. I provided support on all these activities both during and outside of office hours.

The majority of support was a Debian Linux, Apache, Tomcat & MySQL stack, but I also supported various proprietary solutions such as an-all IBM stack consisting of AIX, IHS, WebSphere and DB2 or those based on Microsoft Windows, using  IIS, .NET and MSSQL.
profile_positions.title: Linux Professional

profile_positions.description:
Getronics was a major European systems integrator and hosting provider and has since been acquired by KPN (Royal Dutch Telecom).

As a member of the Computer Operations (COPS) Team at the Amsterdam Datacenter of Getronics, I provided second line support for both Windows and Linux servers. Primary duties involved incident and service request management both during and outside of office hours. As infrastructure and operating systems specialist I was part of the team that developed Utility One, one of the first cloud hosting platforms that directly enables the Infrastructure-as-a-Service concept for our customers. In hindsight this team also was one of the first in the world to deliberately practice DevOps principles to deliver their product.

Customers included financial services companies, national government services and several major multinationals.
profile_positions.title: Systems and Applications Administrator

company.name: Grand Depart Tour de France - Utrecht 2015

volunteer_experiences.description:
During the Grand Depart of the Tour de France in Utrecht, I was one out of 1500 volunteers, that helped with all the work required to make the week-long party and start of the Tour de France a smashing success.

As a crowd manager, I both got to see the action up close and personal as well as helped to make sure the event went safely, smoothly and, above all, as fun as possible for the hundreds of thousands of visitors,

Besides assisting with all the logistics and large crowds associated with such an event, the Grand Depart will also be remembered for the uncommon summer heat wave. Despite this, everything went swimmingly. Beautiful images of the squad going under Dom Tower were broadcast across the world and approximately one million visitors attended without significant incident.
